quotes.quote: The criminal justice system, like any system designed by human beings, clearly has its flaws.
A criminal mind needs consideration rather than the criminal itself. In truth, there are more criminals than those who committed a crime.
Our crime against criminals lies in the fact that we treat them like rascals.
The offender, who repents, is not yet lost.
Criminals should be punished, not fed pastries.
There is no crime in anyone's blood any more than there is goodness in the blood of others. Criminals are not born. They are made by hunger, want and injustice.
Every society has the criminals it deserves.
Every criminal has a good mind conquered by the devil.
Both villains and heroes need to have a steadfast belief in themselves.
Only crime and the criminal, it is true, confront us with the perplexity of radical evil; but only the hypocrite is really rotten to the core.
Villains are meant to be hated.
To destroy an offender cannot benefit society so much as to redeem him.
We're not lawbreakers, we're law-abiding, and intend to stay that way.
Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.
When a judge departs from the letter of the law he becomes a lawbreaker.
All criminals turn preachers under the gallows.
